@redsx:

Your hardware setup sounds pretty awesome. But this is a HDTV rip, it's already pretty compressed both before broadcast and after ripping, so there's so far you can go with good hardware.
Besides, if you know what you're doing you can have a pretty decent 1080p + 2.1 sound setup as your desktop, it doesn't have to be bad just because it's a computer.
If you value quality so much, wait for the Blu-ray release. HDTV rips get nowhere close to actual BD quality. The best you can do is uncompressed, which is huge (might as well buy the BDs), but BDRips are already way better than (relatively crappy) HDTV rips.

Now the real question here is which is better: HDTV vs WEBDL. From firsthand experience, webDL is usually better for animated stuff, but live action... I have no idea. Has anyone compared both releases ?

You can view this file on an HDTV using a PS3 and no conversion is necessary.  Just use the Ps3 media server. Been doing this for close to a year, will play just about any file and you never have to worry about what format.
@7b Every 720p eztv upload that I have seen has been in .mkv because .mkv is the scene standard for 720p. Expect it when you see 720p in a torrents name.

@pratspall Hey I noticed a similar post to yours on the last couple GOT torrents as well. Are you checking mid-way through the show? The intro (what happened last episode part) is always in 2.0. The rest of the show starting with the opening credits is in 5.1. All of the torrents I've DLed for S02E01 and E02 have been 5.1 for the show. Double check man, otherwise it may be something not right in your setup.

@thisisntwhatitlookslike Must be trouble with your blu-ray player and 5.1 sound from the file. The very beginning is in 2.0, at the intro credits it switches to 5.1. Often MKV can be trouble with 5.1 especially if it's encoded with DTS I've found. Try changing some of the audio options on the blu-ray player side. May have to downmix to 2.0 for this.
BTW great torrent as always EZTV! Wife & I religiously get HBO & Showtime shows in HD from you. Keep kicking ass!

I finally got 5.1 passed through correctly; the format switch was giving handbrake fits. FWIW AC3 passthrough is the only option that preserved the 5.1 track for my setup. Not exactly rocket science, but its the first I've heard of it...
